events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred on April 28th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and classified under Auto Accident due to the mention of vehicle collision and damages sustained.
An agent from the auto claims department was assigned to handle the claim and reached out to the customer for initial details.
The insurer formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the process will proceed promptly.
The insurer requested a copy of the police report, photographs of the damaged car, and the customer’s driving license to support the claim.
The customer submitted the required police report, pictures, and identification documents through the online claims portal.
An investigation was initiated to verify the details provided, including contacting witnesses and reviewing traffic camera footage.
The investigation confirmed the liability of the other driver and verified all submitted information was accurate and complete.
A settlement offer was prepared for the customer covering repair costs, rental car reimbursement, and medical expenses.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the clear communication during the process.
After the customer’s acceptance, the claim was formally approved for the full amount proposed in the settlement.
The payment covering all approved expenses, including vehicle repairs and rental reimbursements, was issued to the customer’s bank account.
The claim file was closed following payment issuance, and the customer was informed with a summary of the settlement and closure.
